quest.name: Raubahn's Invitation
journal: Raubahn wishes to thank you for your service.

dialogue.name: SERPENTOFFICER
dialogue.text: I am told one of your comrades was injured during the operation. If there is aught we can do to help, pray do not hesitate to ask.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: ...Maybe we should speak with General Aldynn. Just in case his men learned something about Krile.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Forename[GC Rank], Commander Hext. Fine work you did today.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: After Specula Imperatoris, we needed a resounding victory like this. Thanks to you, Rhalgr's star yet burns bright.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I'm glad, I really am. But you should know that Alisaie was injured in the fighting...

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: ...Regrettable, but I am pleased to hear that she will make a full recovery. Fordola's parting words, on the other hand, ring less favorably in my ears.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: But if Zenos wishes to invite us to his so-called “royal hunt,” then this bull would fain accept!

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: O-Oh, it's nothing really, just that...we're almost to the end, but we've still got to save Krile and do so much more...

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: We'll find her soon enough. Pipin has his best men scouring the castrum's archives as we speak.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: ...Listen, Lyse. It will take time for us to fully occupy the castrum and prepare to advance into the Lochs. While we wait, there is something I would like to show you. Both of you.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: After all, this may be the last chance we have to catch our breath before the final push.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Then come with me to Radiata. From there we'll need to follow another road south.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I don't think I know this village. It's so small...

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Even after all these years, it's still the same... Ah, but I'm getting ahead of myself. You deserve a proper welcome.
